query: What screenwriter with credits for "Evolution" co-wrote a film starring Nicolas Cage and Téa Leoni?
summary:
**Executive Summary:**

David Diamond and David Weissman, a screenwriting duo, co-wrote the 2001 science fiction comedy "Evolution" starring Nicolas Cage and Téa Leoni. They also co-wrote the 2000 film "The Family Man" starring the same actors. This dynamic duo, partners in both life and professionally, boast a 30-year friendship and have contributed to over a dozen movies with a combined box office gross exceeding $1 billion worldwide. Their filmography includes notable comedies such as "Old Dogs" and "When In Rome".
